Articles.Content: Guys should I make download links to my spaceplanes? They are very easy to fly, also don\'t forget they are very fast.

>implying I found KSP on /v/

>implying

video games
In March, I was poking around, hoping there would be an Orbiter 2012. I ran across Kerbal, got .13.2, then .14.
issue 98 of custom pc magazine... released mid september 2011...

Eh, I was on one of my regular forums and I saw a thread with the title Kerbal Space Program - 'Why does it keep exploding? D:'. I was curious, and downloaded it. Then bought it. Games released as alpha or beta to the public only get better as time goes on.
My friend told me about it - he saw it on a gaming site.
HarvesteR\'s post on Orbiter Forum, with the very first public version, 0.7.3
I found it from Kurtjmac
Republican/convervative website Ace of Spades had a thread on video games and Kerbal Space Programs was mentioned and praised, so I downloaded the demo and was hooked.
What? A majority-republican video game forum? What is this blasphemy? ;P

Ahh, cardgame, you misunderstand - it\'s a conservative/Republican website, which for some inexplicable reason decided to take a time out from politics in an election year to mention KSP. So I figured 'It\'s probably pretty fun'.

I was right.
Searched for Orbiter videos on YouTube, but instead found TryDyingToLive\'s tutorials. The rest is history.

Ahh, cardgame, you misunderstand - it\'s a conservative/Republican website, which for some inexplicable reason decided to take a time out from politics in an election year to mention KSP. So I figured 'It\'s probably pretty fun'.

I was right.

I was thinking of something else.

Was watching some video on Youtube by Totalbiscuit, read a random comment telling him to cover KSP, by some crazy idea went to check it out.

I think I\'ve never been this lucky
I was hitting the random button on reddit and it took me to /r/kerbalspaceprogram. After reading a few posts, I was getting the demo, then finally got the paid version.

I was hitting the random button on reddit and it took me to /r/kerbalspaceprogram. After reading a few posts, I was getting the demo, then finally got the paid version.

Talk about serendipity!

I found it by this video by szyzyg

However i did not actually get it until .13 and i bought the game on march 6th

Edited August 12, 2012 by aceassasin

Someone posted a link on Reddit to the teaser trailer at the beginning of March, I watched less than a minute of it and had already bought the game, I didn\'t even bother trying it out first. XD

It was kind of a freaky coincidence that someone had posted the link \'cause I had been searching for a game just before.
I found some random YouTube suggested video on it, back when you could donate for $7 I think? It\'s been a while.

I found a 0.12 article on the Mun on Tigersource when 0.13 was released.

Got demo, found out about persistence, and promptly crapped a golden booster and bought it.
I came here through kurtjmac\'s videos.

X-Rebirth threads, while waiting for news about the game, someone posted about .11, and i decided to check it out. bought it soon after.

:hailprobe:
I just informed PewDiePie of this game! Hopefully he plays it.
Someone on the FinalGear forums started a thread about it, which is what got me interested.
The owner of this minecraft server I used to play on was obsessed with it for a few months. I eventually decided to try it out and have been hooked ever since.
